document_data.name: Szarlnaxi
document_data.mainbody: The '''Szarlnaxi''' ({{Pronounce|sharl|NAK|zee}}) coven was a group of [[Shar]]-worshiping [[vampire]]s that laired within [[Dragonspear Castle]] during the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]]. They took their name from [[Voltan Szarlnaxi|Count Voltan Szarlnaxi]] a [[Tethyrian]] noble that brought them altogether in devotion to the Mistress of the Night.
document_data.Activities: They spent the majority of time in their "hybrid" form, [[humanoid]]s with large leathery wings and features that resembled those of a bat. They only appeared as [[human]]s when they were forced to travel through civilized regions of the [[Western Heartlands]].
document_data.Base of Operations:
Although they originally hailed from [[Baldur's Gate]], the coven was more recently established within the ruins of Dragonspear Castle.

Unlike other vampires, the Szarlnaxi coven didn't have coffins within which they took refuge in during daylight hours.
document_data.Relationships: Sometime around the {{YearlinkName|1484}}, the group came under the influence of the [[rakshasa]] [[Nadir]]. He forced them to believe he was an "emissary of Shar", sent to be the vessel for the soul of Count Voltan Szarlnaxi after it was released from the ''[[portal]]'' to the [[Nine Hells]].
document_data.History:
Count Szarlnaxi was once an influential and powerful noble within the nation of [[Tethyr]]. That changed when he was accused of conspiring against the monarchy and was forced into exile, disappearing into the norther city of [[Baldur's Gate]]. Within the city he amassed a small gang of loyal criminals, and together they found a shared connection under the worship of Shar. Even before their transformation, the group began consuming the blood of the city's poor and destitute.

After some time, Tethyrian agents tracked down the count and killed him outright. Szarlnaxi's followers prayed to Shar and drank from his wounds. For their devotion, the gang of thugs were made [[undead]], and transformed into vampires. Unfortunately for them, the newly-formed coven was ousted from the city. They eventually took refuge within the ruins of Dragonspear Castle in the [[High Moor]].

Around the {{YearlinkName|1485}}, Nadir lured the [[Tempuran]] [[cleric]] [[Darrondar Gweth]] to Dragonspear. The Szarlnaxi vampires ''[[dominate person|dominated]]'' him and imprisoned him within their lair.

Later that year, the ''gate'' to [[Avernus]] beneath Dragonspear Castle was opened for a brief time. It was believed that the remnants of the Szarlnaxi coven cowered away during this event, and later allied themselves with the [[death knight]] [[Queylar Karrault]].
